newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL -- Oracle shares fall after hours.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL -- Oracle shares fall after hours.

text.p: Traders said Oracle Corp shares fell after hours on Thursday, shortly after the company posted its first-quarter results.
Oracle shares slid 1/4 to 37-1/4, traders said. The stock had climbed 7/8 during market hours in heavy volume.
Oracle reported net income of $0.17 per share compared to $0.08 per share, including a charge. The First Call consensus estimate for the quarter was $0.17 per share.

After the bell, International Rectifier Corp said it its first-quarter earnings would fall below expectations and Northstar Health Services Inc said it filed a lawsuit against its former chairman/CEO and former auditor.
Later in the after-hours market, traders said Oracle shares started to rebound, trading at 38 in light volume.
The New York Stock Exchange said its session two volume was 2,500 shares compared with 645,600 shares on Wednesday. There was no session two volume compared with 1,039,500 shares yesterday.
The American Stock Exchange said it had no after-hours volume.
